Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: esther joy m Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I took my entire family to Barcelona for a long cheap weekend. The Hotel was fantastic. Excellent location close to metro and shops and in a safe and quiet area. The staff were very helpful and friendly. We were upgraded free of charge to a bigger room which was ideal for our large family. I would definitely recommend this hotel and am hoping to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean (but tiny) rooms, not so friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Le1cestergrrl
Reviews.Content: Not a bad place. Far from city centre, but easy enough access via the metro, which is within 5 walking. The staff aren't friendly, the rooms are microscopic, and the bed is super uncomfortable. If you are visiting for more than a few days i would look elsewhere. My partner and I were there for two weeks and the room was almost unbearably small. They have free wifi which is a bonus, but they really don't like you in the lobby, which makes me wonder why they put couches in the lobby in the first place. I guess they want you to be in your CRAMPED room!

Reviews.Title: “Nice quality / price”
Reviews.Author: Caprotti85
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not in the city centre, but the overall quality is very good for being just a **. Rooms are big enough, quite comfortable and the bathrooms are renovated. The service is not always very polite.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but beware of some people of the staff”
Reviews.Author: 88Gin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, good for a brief stay, but do not request the parking lot (so smaaaal)! There were some employees so kind and friwndly, but beware of the female at the reception: she's so... acid! By the way: clean rooms, a little bit out of the city but has a metro station in the nearby... In the area you can find a supermarket too and several banks, not so many bars as in the centre... Price/quality... Not worth it, sorry...

Reviews.Title: “Simple and tidy room”
Reviews.Author: TWNH
Reviews.Content: What I like: The recetionists speak quite good English, Spanish and French and are friendly. They pay much attention to everyone that enters the hotel, it feels safe around this area. Free safty box to use at the ground floor. The toliet and shower is new, nice and clean. A supermarket and a great cafe in the corner are just a few steps away from the hotel. What I dislike: The room is quite small, with noisy A/C and you can hear the traffic in street with an opened window. The non-smoking room I had smelled like a smoking room. A half-emptied beer bottle sitting in the fridge. In general it's quite ok for a tidy small room with a reasonable price. I stayed there because my friend live nearby. For active tourists it might not be the best place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience in a two star hotel”
Reviews.Author: evafoi
Reviews.Content: This is only a two star hotel but it was in deed more than that: very clean, new comfortable rooms including bathrooms, friendly and helpfull stuff, good service, great breakfast with a big choice, good location (only 5 min to the metro which brings you within 15 min to the centre). Very, very good price for value. I would go there again while visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Only two stars but a real star!”
Reviews.Author: osopeludo
Reviews.Content: I booked through Booking.com. The price of 47 euros included a buffet breakfast. We stayed the first night at Hotel Confortel Bel Art (51 euros). Due to laziness we would have stayed a second night there but the price had gone up to 76 euros! I hunted around in Trip Advisor for an alternative. Bonanova Park deservedly has good reviews. The hotel. Very convenient. Near the metro. And yet it is quiet. The hotel is sideways on to a quiet-ish road. The receptionist was a very helpful lady (only spoke Spanish). She allowed us to deposit our luggage early in the morning. She volunteered the wifi code (see Bel Art review). Around 2pm we returned after our morning meeting. We asked the lady if there was a good chinese restaurant nearby. She directed us to the SI-CHUAN restaurant (about 2 blocks from the hotel). Please read the separate review for this restaurant. It really was excellent. The best chinese food I've tasted in Spain (18 years) and it cost only 7,95 euros!!! So read the Si-Chuan review! The room (incredibly EXACTLY the same room number as the Bel Art). Slightly smaller than the Bel Art. The furniture was a bit "teak-effect" and there was only one chair. Double bed with blankets. Wifi was OK. A little slow. The minibar was well stocked but expensive. I mean 3,40 euros for a 25cl bottle of cheap beer? lol! The lighting was far better than in the Bel Art. Not a great view. You look out on the next door block of flats. I did like the quaint entrance down a steep slope. The bathroom was excellent. Very clean. The water glasses were in plastic bags and spotless. No bath but a GREAT shower. An overhead shower head as big as the mothership in Independance Day and a separate handheld shower head. Piping hot water. The freebie toiletries were excellent. A comb, 3 shampoo, 3 gel and a decent bar of soap. Soft towels. There didnt appear to be any extraction system to dissipate pong/steam. When you open the "window" in the bathroom you just get an inspection window for about 100 pipes and cables! The walls were a bit thin. You could hear conversations in adjoining rooms. Absolutely no traffic noise. The room decor was slightly dated - 1970's? - and the bedroom radiator reminded me of school classrooms and dormitories. The buffet breakfast was very good. Nothing cooked and hot but more than adequate. I particularly liked the local pastries (almond cake etc). Overall an excellent TWO star hotel. I would rate it alongside the Bel Art which claims FOUR stars. Please read my reviews of Hotel Confortel Bel Art and Si-Chuan Restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: girafferama
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great if you want a basic place to stop whilst sightseeing in Barcelona. We stayed for two nights. It is a five minute walk from Maria Cristina tube stop, which is easily accessible from the airport or train station. It is in a slightly residential area with a supermarket, cafe and bank 2 mins away on foot. It is easy to find (the hotel offered directions), although we did arrive late and got lost in the dark when we walked down the wrong street! The room was fairly basic but very clean and had air conditioning. The bathroom was very nice with a good selection of complimentary toiletries and the room was cleaned for us after our first night. The staff were friendly and helpful. The Camp Nou stadium is literally a 5 minute walk away, so very well located if you are looking to visit, from there we were able to pick up the tourist bus to do our sightseeing and got the tube back quite late in the evening with out any problems. Only complaint would be that the walls appear to be very thin, so you can hear people in adjacent rooms, but this didn't really cause us any problems. All in all a great place to stay if you want somewhere cheap and easy.

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: Paiam
Reviews.Content: Hello, stayed one night in this hotel, a single room. The stricture is ok, the room was quite small but with all the facilities. the bathroom was clean and ok. The WiFi had a good speed. The brakfast was simple but ok . The place is a bit far , a residencial zone close to the Palau Real, about 15-20 minutes by subway (L3) to city center. From the hotel to the closest metro station is about 10-15 minutes walking. My pinion overall is positive. a good place to stay .

Reviews.Title: “Midweek Break”
Reviews.Author: pcw12kcox
Reviews.Content: This is a cheap budget hotel in Barcelona - which does the basics very well. Friendly staff, clean rooms, good - cold continental - breakfast served for 4 hours. The hotel is 7 minutes walk from a tube station, large supermarket, tram station - and newsagent selling all the usual morning UK newspapers! A number of cash points and bars are nearby - and the area feels safe. Room has air conditioning - and windows that open. The hotel has also safe deposit facilities - located behind reception now on the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: Botonguy
Reviews.Content: This hotel/apartment was great, we travelled with a child and the place was centrally located to transport, supermarket and there even was a playground down the road that my son loved. This is not the Ritz-Charlton but if you want a good clean basic hotel that provides you with a fridge, cooker etc for a reasonable price this hotel is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than 2 stars.”
Reviews.Author: Firestopper
Reviews.Content: Way above average! Situated in residential area, 5 minute walk from Diagonal(main city thoroughfair) & metro /tram access. Bus stop & taxi rank right outside door. Small bars/cafes, supermarket, many other shops very nearby. Very nice restaurants/cafes within walking distance. FC Barcelona's Nou Camp stadium only 15 minutes walk away. Tourist Bus pick-up 5 minutes walk away on Diagonal. Room was spotlessly clean. A/C, mini-bar,TV,comfortable beds. Bathroom was faultless, linen changed daily. Did not initially book continental breakfast, however made use of it, at 8 Euros, really good value. Would recomend this hotel to anyone. Light sleepers may hear doors closing, people walking in corridor outside room. Cervesa & vino tinto help eleviate this small problem however! Muy bueno. :-))

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Footie”
Reviews.Author: bampsy
Reviews.Content: I feel the need to write a review for this hotel as i have just returned from a one night stay with my son and it was exceptional for a two star hotel! We travelled from England to see a game at the Camp Nou.The hotel is 15 mins walk to the ground in a nice area.I have stayed in far worse 3 and 4 star hotels in various countries.The hotel and our room was very clean.The room was not big but it was adequate.The shower was hot and it was powerful! The reception staff were very helpful and breakfast was served from 7-11am. As a base for visiting Barcelona i cannot fault this hotel

Reviews.Title: “It is noisy, at least in level 2 .... Ask for upper floors”
Reviews.Author: NoGoodNameLeft
Reviews.Content: Yes, the hotel is easy to reach by underground, is comparably cheap for Barcelona, is clean, has good breakfast. You can ask for the key to the safe deposit box for a deposit (it is free). The single rooms are tiny but OK just to stay the night (nothing more). And on the way to the subway tehre is a a corte ingles mid-size city grocery open almost 24X7 - great to by snacks, bottle of drinks and the like avoiding tourist prices elsewhere .... BUT: I had a room right in level 2 above reception and kittchen. I woke up every day when the kittchen started about 30 minutes before breakast start, maybe because they spoke so loud with the front desk. Also, shower of next room and people walking above were as load as if you were in there room. It is one of these congrete buildings where the inner walls carry the weight and usually transmit noise easily. Believe me, I have read a lot of reviews about hotels with noise complaints that I considered OK, but this room in perticular was sound-open ... Do not get me wrong: Without the front desk /kittchen noise it may very well be quiet, SO DO ASK FOR A ROOM IN THE UPPER FLOORS, the hotels has quiete a few floors.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Cost-Benefit relation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Althoug it is a 2-star hotel, we found it very confortable and well-equiped, speccially considering its cost. The people there is very kind and helpful, and the hotel is exceptionally clean and tidy. The rooms, though basic, are quite spacious and have hughe windows to the street, which is not so common in European 2 or 3-star hotels. About the location, although the hotel is far away from the city centre, there are many shops nearby, including a huge El Corte Inglés departament store in Diagonal Avenue. The distance to downtown Barcelona is easy solved by the very good local underground, having a station nearby. I´d highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to pay a reasonable price and will spend most of his stay enjoying the city and not locked in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic, very clean, very nice!”
Reviews.Author: MemberfromPadova
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only 2-star, but I happened to be at some 4-star which were far worse! Well kept, in a quiet area off the city center, it's no frills but fully satisfactory if you do not expect luxury. Very convenient for shopping and quite close to the subway. I wound up here as the only place I could find in a last-minute business trip at a time when no room was available at nicer hotels. I found it so convenient that I decided to fly my family over and to extend my stay for the weekend. Staff were friendly and polite. A really nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “A very good two star hotel”
Reviews.Author: RegisToronto
Reviews.Content: I had a good experience in this hotel. It is two stars so no luxury, but they get the basics right: tidy room, clean sheets, decent size and equipped bathroom, TV, work desk and air conditioned facilities. The breakfest is basic - cold cuts only - but appropriate. The hotel is 5-10 minutes walking from the Maria Christina metro stop, in the business district of Barcelona. Very nice shopping opportunities all around. It took me 30 minutes to get to the hotel from the airport using public transportation (train from airport to Station Sants and then green metro line to Maria Christina station). Paid EUR 48 per night.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent two star hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: WE arruved ub Barcelona having booked this hotel for just one night in case it was not up to expectations. It met and exceeded our expectations. The rooms are small but spotless and very well equipped. Overall it was excellent value for the price and i would highly recommend it
